Q2

Class AddAndDFT

  • java.lang.Object
    • Q2.AddAndDFT
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddAndDFTMonitor, AddAndDFTMutex

    public abstract class AddAndDFT
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that does DFT(A+B) to two randomly generated matrices of complex numbers. Does it in a multi threaded fashion which helps parallelize this operation. Provides configurable matrix sizes and thread numbers.
    Author:
    Yasir

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  AddAndDFT.Worker
      Worker thread class that receives a range of indices to calculate, does addition between input matrices, waits for other worker threads to finish that step, and continues on to do DFT on the given portion.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int _arrived
      Parallelization variable do determine how many threads have reached the barrier
      private boolean _isCancelled
      Control variable that is used to stop ongoing calculation
      private ComplexMatrix _m1
      First parameter of the input matrices
      private ComplexMatrix _m2
      Second parameter of the input matrices
      protected int _matrixSize
      Size of each dimension of the matrices
      protected int _threadCount
      Number of threads that will perform this operation
      ComplexMatrix Result
      Result of the DFT(A+B) operation

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddAndDFT(int threadCount, int matrixSize)
      Constructor that creates 2 matrices with given dimension sizes, randomizes them and initializes the result of the operation as an empty matrix

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract void Barrier()
      Parallelization mechanism that should be used by the threads so that they can start their DFT operation after all addition finishes.
      boolean Calculate()
      Shares the matrix among the threads that has given in the initialization step, starts each worker thread and starts a timer to count how many milliseconds have passed since the start of the operation.
      void Cancel()
      Cancels the on-going calculations in the threads

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddAndDFT

        public AddAndDFT(int threadCount,
                 int matrixSize)
        Constructor that creates 2 matrices with given dimension sizes, randomizes them and initializes the result of the operation as an empty matrix
        Parameters:
        threadCount - Number of threads that will be involved in the calculation
        matrixSize - Size of the each dimension of each matrix

    • Method Detail

      • Cancel

        public void Cancel()
        Cancels the on-going calculations in the threads

      • Calculate

        public boolean Calculate()
        Shares the matrix among the threads that has given in the initialization step, starts each worker thread and starts a timer to count how many milliseconds have passed since the start of the operation. Waits for worker threads to end and outputs the time passed for the whole operation.
        Returns:
        True if the operation has ended without interruption, false otherwise

      • Barrier

        protected abstract void Barrier()
        Parallelization mechanism that should be used by the threads so that they can start their DFT operation after all addition finishes. Since there are multiple ways of parallelization, this method has made abstract and left for deriving class to implement any mechanism they might want to.
